Violation_Type: Failure to meet residency requirement for citizenship
Legal_Issue: Whether Mr. Nandre met the residency requirement under the Citizenship Act
Application_Facts: Mr. Nandre was physically present in Canada for 763 days over four years; maintained property ownership and cultural involvement; spent significant time abroad due to employment
Decision_Outcome: Appeal allowed; application remanded for further consideration
Remedy_Requested: Minister's appeal against approval of citizenship application
Defendant_Behavior: Mr. Nandre applied for citizenship but could not prove when residence was established
Grounds_for_Claim: Failure to establish date of establishment of residence despite strong ties to Canada
Legal_Standard: Three years of residence in Canada during previous four years; physical presence or qualitative test based on strong ties
Assessment_Factor: Physical presence, property ownership, cultural involvement, duration of absences, employment-related travel
Procedural_Issue: Federal Court review of Citizenship Judge's decision
Review_Standard: Interpretation and application of residency requirements under the Citizenship Act
Evidence_Used: Record of physical presence (763 days), proof of property ownership, evidence of cultural involvement, employment records
Application_Basis: Qualitative test for residence considered due to insufficient physical presence
Evidence_Assessed: Duration of stay, connections to Canada, timing of establishment of residence
Relief_Sought: Overturning of Citizenship Judge’s approval of Mr. Nandre’s application
Governing_Rule: Residence requires either three years of physical presence or demonstration of strong ties with establishment of residence
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Failure to prove when Mr. Nandre established residence in Canada
Outcome: Appeal allowed; remanded for determination of when residence was established
Cause_Description: Minister appealed Citizenship Judge's approval of Mr. Nandre's citizenship application over residency concerns
Evidence_Handling: Court reviewed evidence of presence and ties but found gap in proving establishment of residence
Evidence_Issues: Insufficient evidence regarding the date residence was established
Residency_Compliance: Not fully established; physical presence below threshold, qualitative factors present but key element missing
Legal_Provision: Citizenship Act - Section on residency for citizenship eligibility
Evidence_Assessment: Strong ties acknowledged, but lack of evidence on timing of residence establishment deemed critical
Decision_Rationale: Qualitative test may apply, but applicant must still prove when residence was established; failure to do so necessitates remand
Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of documentation or testimony establishing when Mr. Nandre began residing in Canada
Legal_Standard_Applied: Dual test for residence: physical presence or strong ties with demonstrated establishment
